bel_statement.title: BEL Statement
bel_statement.description: A BEL Statement is an expression that represents knowledge of the existence of biological entities and relationships between them that are known to be observed within a particular context, based on some source of prior knowledge such as a scientific publication or newly generated experimental data.

citation.title: Citation
citation.description: The citation specifies the written source where the biological knowledge was referenced.

type.title: Citation Type
type.description: The citation type of the reference.

id.title: Citation ID
id.description: The citation identifier (PubMed ID, ISBN, DOI, URL) of the reference.

name.title: Citation Name
name.description: The citation name of the reference.

date.title: Citation Date
date.description: The citation date of the reference.

authors.title: Citation Authors
authors.description: The citation authors of the reference.

comment.title: Citation Comment
comment.description: The citation comment of the reference.

biological_context.title: Biological Context
biological_context.description: A biological context specifies the experiment's parameters where this interaction was observed.

ncbi_tax_id.title: NCBI Taxonomy ID
ncbi_tax_id.description: NCBI taxonomy id - e.g. 9606 is the id for Homo sapien

species_common_name.title: Species common name
species_common_name.description: Common name for species like human, mouse or rat

summary_text.title: Summary Text
summary_text.description: Abstract from source text to provide support for this evidence

metadata.title: Evidence resource metadata
metadata.description: Metadata that describes the evidence resource.
